column1: short of length outside off, dabbed towards cover-point by Liton
another short of length ball, some extra bounce this time, Liton adjusts well to guide it towards third man. Bangladesh are off the mark
once again short of length, angling across the left-hander. A tentative push by Imrul towards point
length ball, much closer to the body this time, punched with a little bit more confidence, in the direction of cover
length ball, around off stump, Imrul comes forward and defends it right under his eyes
length again, fourth stump line, pushed towards mid-off
length ball, just outside off, dabbed towards point

a missed run-out chance. Length ball, Liton dabs it towards point and sets off, Sean Williams was quick to the ball and had all the time in the world to aim and throw. Liton had given up completely but Williams misses the stumps
down the leg side and called a wide
once again on the pads, flicked away towards fine leg for a single
fuller and wider outside off, Imrul goes up and over cover for the first boundary of the innings
length outside off, defended this time
length ball but on the pads once more, tucked away by Liton towards fine leg for a run
almost chopped on! It was a length ball, Imrul was looking to force it on the off side, gets an inside edge that just evades the stumps
fuller, outside off, Imrul comes forward and opens the face of the bat to run it past the second slip, the third man fielder cuts it off
length outside off, comes forward and defends towards cover
short of length outside off, Liton was looking to pull it squarer, but misses it altogether
length outside off, Liton watches it before letting it go, some late seam movement there for Jarvis

a tad fuller this time and pushed uppishly towards short cover where Raza takes it but signals straightaway to the umpires to refer it upstairs. The soft signal is out. It's close but he seems to have his fingers underneath the ball. They need a conclusive evidence to rule this not out. But the third umpire thinks the ball touched the grass there and Liton survives
length outside off and Imrul has a wild swing at it, misses it completely
a touch fuller and straighter, just outside off, defended
short of length outside off, some extra bounce there for Chatara. Defended towards covers
short of length outside off, driven towards point but straight to the fielder
extra bounce, it jumps from short of a length and surprises Imrul who was looking to fend at it, gets hit near the shoulder
length outside off, Imrul looks to go aerial but misses completely
short of length, pulled straight to short midwicket
length outside off, steered towards backward point where a fumble allows a single
on the pads this time and flicked away in the air, but falls well short of the man at deep square leg, only a single
down the track to a short of length ball, it was wide as well and Liton had to reach for it in the end, toe-end it towards short midwicket
once again use of feet but guided nicely towards third man this time
on the pads and flicked away in the air. The square leg fielder messes it up altogether, drops the catch and lets the ball roll to the fence
finally a wicket for Zimbabwe! down the track and looks to chip it over mid-off. But Liton doesn't get his timing right and a good tumbling catch to his left by Zhuwao
short of length and pulled awkwardly towards square leg, falls short of the fielder
another bouncer, but it sails over the batsman who ducks under it
fuller on stumps this time, pushed towards mid-on
length ball, comes forward and defends it on the off side
a lifter there from Chatara and Bangladesh lose their second wicket. The debutant departs for a duck as he fends at this one and Taylor takes a one-handed catch, jumping to his left
on the pads, Imrul misses the flick, an appeal for lbw but it was heading down
fuller outside off, Mushfiqur goes for the drive, gets an inside edge to fine leg, not the best of the ways to get off the mark
fuller on pads and tucked away to the left of mid-on for a quick single
back of length outside off, stays in his crease and defends solidly
short of length, coming into the right-hander, steered towards third man
fuller outside off, driven but straight to the fielder at mid-off
length ball, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on for a quick single, makes it comfortably in the end
back of length, in the rib cage, tucked away towards square leg
length outside off, in the channel, left alone
on the pads this time, flicked away towards backward square leg for a single
slower one but down the leg side, that needs to be bowled again
short of length this time but once again down the leg side, another wide
length ball, into the body this time, defended
short of length, jumps at the batsman who pushes it back towards the bowler
fuller on stumps, driven towards mid-on but straight to the man
fuller and wider and Mushfiqur slashes at it, gets a thick outside edge which flies over Masakadza at first slip
length outside off, opens the face of the bat to run it towards third man
length ball, comes forward and defends it towards cover
bouncer this time, but Imrul ducks under it quite comfortably
slower one, played with soft hands towards mid-on for a quick single
short of length outside off, Imrul gets on his toes and punches it through covers for a crunching boundary
length ball, on the pads, worked away towards backward square leg for a single
length ball, just outside off, Mushfiqur gets back and drops it on the off side
fuller this time, Mushfiqur comes forward and pushes it towards mid-off and sprints to the other end for a quick run
short of length, Imrul was early into the shot and ends up chipping it towards square leg
length ball, comes forward and defends
angles this full across the stumps, defended.
drive on the up, just eludes backward point. Saw the width and threw his bat at the delivery.
length ball angling away, he stands tall and punches to cover point.
short but this is way over the batsman's head, left alone without a hassle.
slower length delivery angled across, defended from the crease.
looks to belt this over mid-on, but gets a thick inside edge to the fielder instead.

beautiful shot. Sees this full, gets underneath the length and goes straight. Launched into the sightscreen. As a batsman, shots like those give you immense satisfaction. The smile told you a story. Friendly half-volley that time, deserved to be put away and this was quite magnificently.
length outside off, steered to square third man
floats this full around off stump, driven authoritatively but straight to mid-off.
off a thick inside edge to square leg. Looked to punch this on the up.
attacks the stumps with a length ball that veers in late, Mushfiqur tucks this down to fine leg.
whipped away to deep midwicket for an easy single.
hits him high on the bat as he defends back towards the bowler.
starts well. Lands this on a length, just around middle, defended with soft hands.
drops short, he rocks back and pulls all along the ground to deep square leg.
tossed up, invites the drive by pitching it on off stump. Driven with the spin to mid-off.
nurdled with the spin to square leg.
turns this gently into the square leg region for an easy single.
slips this down leg, the keeper can't gather cleanly and they'll scamper a bye in addition to the wide
leading edge, but doesn't carry to the bowler. Mushfiq was looking to work this through midwicket
banged in short, excellent bouncer on middle, Imrul shapes to pull but bails out at the last moment. Excellent decision too.
slower length ball outside off, steers this straight to backward point.
lifter from a length on middle and off, Imrul takes a step across to defend but gets a thick inside edge towards square leg.
well-controlled work off his wrists to square leg. Kept it all along the ground.

slower, fuller and belted away! Once again, picked this off his hand immediately and decided to straight downtown. Superb timing, aesthetically pleasing and result extremely satisfying. Superb from Imrul
thick outside edge to third man as he tries to work this to the leg side. Closed the bat face a little too early in trying to work this towards midwicket
skids one through on a length but outside leg, may have brushed the thigh pad as he tried to tickle fine.
gets outside the line of the stumps and smothers this tossed up delivery.
driven back hard, but well stopped by the bowler in his followthrough
beaten by the fizz, attempted googly but not much turn. He rocked back to cut but couldn't connect
too much width outside off, length way too short as well. Slapped away to deep point.

this is a short ball drifting in towards leg stump, Mushfiqur looks to pull, plays too early and in doing so has got some glove on this. Excellent grab down the leg side by the wicketkeeper, who may have been blinded just a touch. But his balance was superb as he made a swift move to complete the catch. Dharmasena's decision overturned and Bangladesh are wobbling.
stands tall and punches to deep point
skiddy short of length delivery on the stumps, defended back.
full on off, hint of movement away, defended into the off side with soft hands.
gets half a stride in to stab this length delivery on off stump.
punched but can't pierce the packed off-side ring. The cover fielder puts his left hand out to stop that.
eases this length delivery carefully towards point.
slides across the shortish delivery, eased to sweeper cover.
tucked to short fine, Imrul refuses the single.
chipped, but just short of the man coming in from cover. Good bowling, got this to dip on Mithun.
bounce from outside off, he shapes to cut but gets a thick edge over the slip fielder. Lucky boundary
skids one in to cramp Mithun for room as he attempts to pull, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad.
gets to the pitch and eases this with the spin to long-off.
works this to square leg for an easy single
drops short, he makes room and cracks this to deep point
quicker one on middle and leg, turns this to the leg side, short fine come swooping in.
drilled down to long-on for an easy single
slides one back in from round the stumps, gets a thick inside edge towards mid-on
lunges forward and smothers this delivery quite nicely.
crashed off the backfoot to deep cover.
works this with the spin to midwicket
googly that he reads off the pitch, bunted into the off side for a quick single
breaks away from length outside off, draws him forward. Defended with soft hands.
pulled away into the gap. There was deep square, deep midwicket and he bisected the gap to perfection.
turns this into the gap at square leg.
tossed up outside off, pushed back to the bowler.
fired in quickly on a length, defended to short cover.
right to the pitch of the ball as he eases to long-off and brings up his half-century
punches straight to cover
gets to the pitch of the ball and drives down to long-off.
on the shorter side, he whips this down to deep midwicket
tossed up on stumps, driven through extra cover for a single
length ball, around middle and leg, defended towards square leg
length again, on the pads, worked around the corner this time
fuller outside off, Mithun looks to go big down the ground but ends up dragging it towards mid-on
length ball, just outside off, defended
down the track, looks to go over the top but ends up skying it towards deep extra cover, falls short of the fielder
fuller on stumps, tucked away towards short fine leg
fuller and wide this time, hit firmly but cover fielder cuts it off
length ball, around middle and leg, pushed towards fine leg
length outside off, pushed towards extra cover off the front foot
long hop and Mithun takes full advantage of that, pulls it over deep midwicket for a six with a lot of power
length ball, just outside off, defended this time by Mithun
a low full toss on leg stump, Imrul looks to work it inside out, couldn't get it past the extra cover fielder
fuller once again, pushed back towards the bowler
length ball, just outside off, Imrul steers it to short third man

goes for the slog sweep and splits the gap in the deep, there was a backward square leg and deep midwicket in place but Imrul bisects them perfectly for a maximum. 100 comes up for Bangladesh with that six
back to back sixes, it was short, just outside off, Imrul went deep and pulled it over midwicket this time
googly on the pads, played gently towards square leg for a quick single
length ball, pushed towards long-off for a single
short and wide and Mithun cuts it past short third man, sweeper cover puts in the full-length dive to prevent a boundary
pitched up this time and driven towards deep extra cover for two more
fuller again and driven, a fumble by the man at extra cover allows a single in the end
fuller outside off, driven, Raza makes a diving stop to his right
tossed up on stumps, played inside out towards extra cover
starts with a down the leg side wide
fuller on stumps, driven towards short midwicket
length around middle and leg, defended back towards the bowler
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but doesn't get the timing right, straight to the backward point fielder
length ball, pitching on middle and spinning away, defended on the off side
length ball, going in with the arm to beat the bat, an appeal for lbw but it was going down
length ball around middle and leg, pushed back towards the bowler
fuller on stumps, driven towards long-off for a walking single
length ball, around middle and leg, worked towards short midwicket
tossed up outside off from around the wicket, gave Mithun enough room to free his arms who lofts it over long-on for a maximum
another six! Almost an action replay of the previous ball, only it was hit a bit straighter. The Mirpur crowd has suddenly come alive
fuller and driven firmly back towards the bowler
length ball, just outside off, pushed towards the left of the bowler who dives across to stop it
short of length around middle and leg, punched back
length ball, on the pads, worked away towards backward square leg
short of length outside off, cut away but there is a sweeper cover in place
length ball, on the pads, Imrul looks to glance but misses, the ball rolls towards short fine leg off the pads
another one down the leg side and it's a wide this time
fuller outside off, driven back towards the bowler
length outside off, Imrul goes back and steers it towards deep backward point
short of length, around middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg

and gone! Another good catch by Taylor behind the stumps. It was a length ball, just outside off, Mithun pushes at it but extra bounce once again does the trick, forces an outside edge and a good tumbling catch by Taylor to his right
length outside off, Mahmudullah comes forward and defends
length again, Mahmudullah comes on the front foot and defends with an open face this time
fuller outside off, driven firmly but the cover fielder cuts it off

and given! But Mahmudullah reviews it straightaway. It was a length ball, just around off stump, Mahmudullah pushes at it and the bowler and there is an appeal for caught-behind. Replays confirm there was a spike when the ball passed the bat and Mahmudullah departs for a duck
short of length outside off, Imrul goes for a cut but the ball kept low as he misses out
length ball, pushed towards short midwicket
length again, defended by Imrul
length outside off, dabbed towards point for a quick single
fuller on stumps, driven towards long-on
a mix-up there. It was a length ball and Imrul works it around the corner, straight to the fielder but the non-striker was half-way down the track. However, he manages to undo his steps just in time
length ball, just around off, defended
length outside off, punched off the back foot but straight to the cover fielder
and another one departs, Mehidy Hasan this time and it's the fifth catch for Brandon Taylor. It was a length ball outside off, Mehidy went for the cut only to edge it behind
length outside off, punched off the back foot towards covers
length ball, just around off, kept a tad low but Saifuddin got his bat down just in time
a tad fuller this time, Saifuddin comes forward and pushes it towards cover
short of length around off, defended
short of length around off, extra bounce there, pushed towards point
short of length once again but some room outside off this time, slashed towards sweeper cover
fuller but way too outside off, on the second bounce to the wicketkeeper

edged and taken by Ervine at first slip. It was short of length, extra bounce once again doing the trick as Saifuddin pushes at it. A low catch there by Ervine but the umpires are not sure. They are checking upstairs, the soft signal is not out, mind you. Does he have his fingers underneath, it's very difficult to judge. After a million replays, the third umpire makes his decision in favour of the batsman
and beaten. A similar line and length and similar response by the batsman. The only difference is he missed it this time
length ball, just outside off, defended on this occasion
short of length, around middle and off, defended
short and pulled away but a brilliant diving effort by the man at deep square leg to keep it to just one
a tad fuller on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
short of length on the pads, and another single to square leg
short of length, climbing towards the batsman who does well to keep it down, one more to square leg
better line this time, length ball just around off stump, defended towards covers
short of length outside off, defended towards short cover
fuller and wider this time, driven towards deep extra cover
short of length, on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
length ball, just outside off, punched towards cover-point
fuller outside off, driven this time but once again in the same direction
length ball, angling across the left-hander who defends it towards point
slower bouncer, the batsman ducks under it but it bounces just in front of Taylor who fails to gather it but does well to get some part of his body behind
length outside off, left alone
short of length, jumps at the batsman, who does well to keep it down
a touch fuller this time, Saifuddin goes for a drive but misses
length ball, comes forward and defends
fuller on stumps, clipped away towards midwicket for a single. 150 comes up for Bangladesh
length ball, around middle, chipped uppishly towards mid-on but well short of the fielder
short of length and pulled away this time, over midwicket for a boundary
short of length this time, played gently towards square leg, straight towards the fielder, a loud no from Imrul there as he saw Saifuddin charging down
fuller and wider, driven towards sweeper cover
length ball, just outside off, defended towards point
fuller and driven past the diving extra cover fielder, sweeper comes around to cut it off
goes right back into the crease and bunts this to short third man
grip and turn from the rough, beats the inside edge to hit him on the body. Imrul was deep inside the crease as he tried to play that
gets to the pitch of the ball and works this down to long-on
shortens his length, punched to the bowler, who pushes it away as he dives to stop. They scamper a single

delightfully executed reverse sweep. Gave away his intentions early, but the bowler still drifted this across the left-hander. He was in superb position to power this past short third man. Rolled his wrists nicely to keep this all along the ground.
plays the conventional sweep this time, all along the ground to deep backward square leg.
eased to long-on
turns this gently towards the man coming in from deep square leg.
spins back in to beat the tickle down leg, Taylor fumbles and they get across for a bye as well, so two more to the score.
squeezes this yorker-length delivery back to the bowler.
goes right back into the crease to turn this tossed up delivery into the leg side.
right behind the line as he defends.
makes a bit of room and cuts to deep point.
drops short, so he rocks back and pulls all along the ground to deep midwicket
rocks back and crashes this short delivery to sweeper cover.
punches this straight to short midwicket
sharp turn but the impact may have been just outside off. Thin inside edge too as he defended forward.
lunges forward and defends this gently back to the bowler
makes room and eases this into the gap at point for a single.
tossed up on leg stump, smothered pretty nicely.
full toss that has been whipped straight back to the bowler.
rocks back and hammers this short delivery into the gap at midwicket. That will definitely break the shackles.
leading edge that rolls into the off side, closed the bat face a little too early.
jabs this away into the gap towards point for a quick single.
fires in a yorker, kept out somehow.
gentle push into the covers for a single, but he'll get an extra run because there's an overthrow at the bowler's end.
makes a bit of room and punches into the gap at cover.
tossed up on middle and leg, worked with the spin towards deep midwicket
right on top of the bounce as he turns this into the leg side.
turns this into the gap between deep midwicket and deep square, good work by the boundary riders though.
bisects deep square and deep midwicket perfectly. Dropped short, he was right back inside the crease to muscle this into the gap, couple of bounces to the ropes. The crowd roars.
fired into the stumps from round the wicket, blocked.
eased with the spin towards cove point.
breaks away from length outside off, bunted to point.
drifts in to middle and leg, worked to square leg.
looks to flay this cut but gets a thick outside edge that races past short third man. Raises the half-century stand
stands tall and punches this to sweeper cover.
works this down to long-on for an easy single.
slides one across at length, bunted into the off side.
firmly driven but straight to cover.
sharp turn but this spins back in to beat the pad, good take by Taylor.
rocks back and pulls this into the gap at deep midwicket. Poor ball, too short and he had all the time in the world to open up the leg side and power this away. Valiant effort by PJ Moor.
eased back to the bowler, who fires a throw to the keeper. Saifuddin was outside the crease and had to scamper back through a dive
dabs this gently from the crease.
sways out of the line of this short delivery but it was sprayed far too wide outside off.

there's his century! What a knock, what celebration! The cradle celebration. The dressing room is up on their feet to acknowledge a crucial knock. He got into of the bounce and turned this short of length delivery into the leg side for a quick single to bring up his landmark
turns this wide of midwicket for another quick single.
pulls and misses. This short delivery was angling away, he was through with the stroke way too early.
drills this full delivery straight to mid-off.
full and angling away, he bunts this into the off side for a quick single.
right in his half and he drills this into the gap at deep extra cover. Magnificent timing, even better placement. Raises the 200 for Bangladesh.
slices this lofted hit on the bounce to sweeper cover.

appeal for caught behind as he tries to deflect this full delivery wide of the keeper. The sound was that of bat touching the ground. Zimbabwe have reviewed anyway and it comes back a no-ball, so whatever happens after that goes out of the window. Let's move on. Chatara's front foot was on the line and that belongs to the umpire. Free-hit coming up
backs away, makes room and slaps this with all his might but on the bounce to the fielder at deep cover.
backs away to slap this over point but is beaten
keeps low as he stands tall to punch, pushed to cover.
full toss, he's down on one knee as he drills this drive to beat sweeper cover. The timing there is simply magnificent
makes room but has to reach this length ball angling away, flat-batted to long-off.
off a thick inside edge, just bounces over the stumps to the keeper.
steps out and flat-bats this short ball over the bowler's head. Long-on runs around to where long-off would be to come up with a sliding stop.
play and a miss, this was slower and angling away. On the bounce to the keeper.
pulled away, fine leg comes around to cut that off.
pulled, on the bounce to midwicket.
he's clobbered this over long-on. Oh, boy! Sensational. Short and angling away, he made room and then flat-batted this to clear the man.
toe-ends a flick to short fine leg.

this time he exhibits his range by clearing long-off. What muscle, what timing. Cleared his front leg, made room, got underneath the length and lofted it through the line. It was a slower one and he picked it up very quickly.
full toss and he's swung this away into the open space at deep midwicket. Williams looks to run around and stop at long-on but can't get there
full toss and he's punched this on the up to deep cover.
full toss outside off, punched to deep point.

clears long-off, my word. I thought this was off the bottom of the bat. How good are the blades these days? Backed away, had width and he swung this away but got it far from the middle. Still cleared long-off.
goes over cover this time, the outfield is quite slippery because of the dew and Raza slips in trying to push the ball back in
crunching cover drive to sweeper cover.

makes room, gets underneath the length and carves this over extra cover. The man in the deep over-ran the ball and slipped in trying to recover. Heavy dew, greasy outfield, not-so-good diving technique
walks across to fetch this on the full and sweeps this behind square to beat deep square leg. Magnificent, what placement and premeditation
toe-ends a lofted hit towards long-on
through with the pull even before the ball arrived, thin bottom edge that rolls to the keeper.
makes room and drives to extra cover. Didn't get it off the middle again

this is sensational. Whatever he hits turns gold. This is a slower length ball, Imrul sashays down the pitch and nonchalantly flat-bats this to clear long-off. Made a hit of room to free his arms and then club it away
walks across and sweeps this waist-high full toss to the deep backward square leg boundary. Excellent improvisation.
yorker-length on middle, he makes room and squeezes this into the covers.
stands tall and works this into the midwicket region.
drills this back past the bowler to long-off.
cheeky little late deflection down to third man.
gentle push past the bowler, they scamper a run to take Saifuddin to 49

carved away but he's hold out to sweeper cover. End of a magnificent knock. Looked a tired shot, because he was thrown off balance. They'll check for a no-ball it seems fine. All the Zimbabwe fielders walk up to shake hands with Imrul. He walks off to a standing ovation. What entertainment he's provided. First the rescue, then the thrill. Superb and he deserves all the applause that comes his way. More relief than elation in the Bangladesh camp.
squeezes this full delivery down to long-on
tickles this off the pad to the keeper, the run is turned down though.
full toss, waist-high outside off, and he's hit this straight down the throat of long-off. Got it high on the bat, I thought, and so was denied the kind of timing or power.
floats this full and just a touch wide outside the line. Another run into the kitty
mistimes this lofted hit off a full toss to long-off.
swing and a miss. This was full and very close to the wide line. He made room to loft inside-out.
beaten again as he looks to carve out this wide yorker.
walks across the stumps and heaves this full toss into the wide long-on region.
length ball, around middle, defended back towards the bowler
length ball, pitching around off and middle, defended on the leg side
length, around off stump this time, Masakadza gets behind the line and blocks again
length ball but way down the leg side this time around
short of length, some extra bounce their, Masakadza dabs it down behind square leg
length ball, angling across, kept a tad low there as Zhuwao defends it from the crease
length ball, once again angling across, Zhuwao pushes at it and gets beaten
length ball, driven towards long-on for a single
length ball from around the wicket, Zhuwao looks to sweep it from outside off, gets beaten
lovely bowling, draws the batsman forward and beats him with turn
this one goes straight with the arm, a thick inside edge rolls towards square leg
length ball, comes forward and pushes it back towards the bowler
length again and another front-foot push back to the bowler
length ball, just outside off, Zhuwao was looking to cut it hard but the ball sneaks in through bat and pad
crashed away this time, length ball and some room to free his arms and Zhuwao cuts it past backward point
shorter and wider and Zhuwao once again goes for the cut but the ball remains low and goes underneath the bat, one bounce to the wicketkeeper
length ball, just outside off, Zhuwao throws his bat at it, gets a thick outside edge past the first slip, third man cuts it off
length ball, just around off, Masakadza pushes at it and the ball races towards third man off the outer half of the bat
length ball, around middle, defended towards short midwicket
down the wicket, but Mehidy sees him and pulls his length back, pushed towards long-on
short and wide and Zhuwao rocks back to hammer it past extra cover for his second four
up and over extra cover this time, Nazmul, in the deep, chases it and pulls it just inside
short of length once again, cuts it again but this time straight to the extra cover fielder
pitched up and driven inside out past the extra cover fielder
fuller on stumps, pushed to short midwicket
short of length outside off, Zhuwao goes back and punches it uppishly through covers for another boundary in the region
length ball, Zhuwao looks to hit straight this time but ends up playing the wrong line, the ball goes over the off stump
Zhuwao repeats the shot but gets an outside edge this time which goes over the slip cordon
length ball around off stump and Masakadza dispatches it nonchalantly to the square leg fence
length ball, coming in with the angle and beats the bat to rap Masakadza on the thigh, was heading down though
length outside off, Masakadza gets on his toes and punches it to the left of the mid-off fielder for a quick single
length ball, around middle and leg, defended on the leg side
use of feet this time to drive it straight, the ball bounces over the bowler's head before mid-off cuts it off
length outside off, goes for the sweep but fails to make contact. He was looking to smash it
arm-ball this time, cramping the batsman for the room who blocks it on the off side
use of feet this time to chip it over the infield and it sails over the deep midwicket fence
in the arc, out of the park. It was full, around off and Zhuwao lofts it over long-on for the second six of the over
length outside off, Masakadza pushes at it and gets beaten
length ball, punches it towards mid-on and sets off for a quick single, a direct hit would have been closes
length ball from around the stumps, hardly any room for Zhuwao who was caught at the crease, a thick inside edge goes past the stumps and beats the man at short fine leg
length ball, around middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
back of length outside off, defended
length outside off, sixth stump line, left alone
but starts with a leg side wide
bowled him! Length ball, comes back off the pitch and sneaks in through the gap between the bat and the pad to send the off stump cartwheeling
length ball, came slower off the wicket, Taylor almost ends up chipping it back
length ball, angling across, defended towards cover
length ball, angling away, left alone
back of length outside off, Taylor stays back and defends it towards cover

Was in the air but away from the bowler, it was a bit fuller this time, Taylor was looking to play it towards covers but closes the face of the bat early. As a result the ball goes in the direction of the non-striker, there was a chance of the second run but batsmen decide against it
length ball, just outside off, chipped past the bowler for a single
turn and bounce, length ball just outside off, Masakadza was going back but the bounce surprises him as he lets it go in the end
length ball punches it on the off side
short of length outside off, forced off the back foot towards long-off
length ball, outside off, chipped uppishly towards backward point
length outside off, cuts it past the cover fielder who chases it all the way to keep it to two
fuller and wider, Taylor goes for it, gets an outside edge past the slip fielder
length ball, around middle and leg, defended towards short midwicket
length outside off, punched towards cover for a quick single, Taylor was a bit late to start off but makes it easily in the end
length outside off, angling across the right-hander, left alone
length outside off, around sixth stump, another leave
another length ball outside off and another leave
mistimes this cut to extra cover
nice flight, lands it outside off, driven with the spin to long-off.
extra bounce, he makes room and bunts this into the gap at cover.

beauty of a delivery and he brings out the snake dance. Taylor is gone and this is a body blow for Zimbabwe. Lovely, lovely delivery. Got this to drift in from round the stumps, drew Taylor forward but he made the grave mistake of feeling for the delivery without covering the line. Played inside the line as a result and saw the ball deviate just a wee bit to beat the outside edge and crash into the stumps. As a left-arm spinner, you can't bowl a better delivery. Bangladesh are on top with that wicket. Superb from Nazmul, that would've made spin bowling coach Sunil Joshi mighty proud.
gets outside the line of the stumps and smothers this nicely.
driven back off a thick inside edge to the bowler.
driven firmly into the gap at extra cover, but lazy running from Masakadza. Should've been three there.
right behind the line of length delivery as he defends.
drilled back, this hits Mustfizur's boot as he tries to get out of the way on his followthrough
cutter that he lands on a length on middle, defended from the crease.
width and he punches this on the up, excellent stop by the mid-off fielder running to his left.
full, just around off, defended back.
square turn but he manages to bunt this with soft hands

poor, poor running. Driven past the diving cover fielder. There was never a second, but they still decided to chance one. Excellent work from the wide long-off fielder who charged in and released the ball in a jiffy at the correct end. The throw to Mushfiqur wasn't all that accurate, but Mushfiqur did well to take it on the full and then lunge towards the stumps and break it airborne. Masakadza was miles short and Zimbabwe have lost a third. Outstanding glovework. Brain freeze from the batsman. Imrul having a dream day, he can do no wrong.
right back inside the crease as he defends.
eased with the spin towards cover point. Nice flight again
square turn, there's bounce and fizz off the pitch to beat the outside edge by a whisker
gets outside the line of the stumps and smothers this pretty nicely.
slants one across the left-hander, left alone.
stands tall and punches this into the gap at extra cover.
whips this length ball angling away to mid-on.
stands tall and deflects this down to square third man for an easy single
full, veering in late towards middle, squeezed back.
width outside off, punched to extra cover.
struck on the pad as he attempts the sweep, but this was turning too much.
spins back in to whizz past the pad as he tries to tickle fine. Harsh call me thinks.
gets outside the line to defend, this one hits a patch and bounces more to hit him on the flap of the pad
gets a long way forward and smothers this.
breaks back in sharply to hit him on the flap of the pad.
sharp turn to beat the forward prod and hit him on the pad. Big turn, they think of a review but decide against it. May have missed leg
whips this shortish delivery on middle to deep midwicket
slants a length ball across, keeps low but Ervine is somehow right behind the line.
full and slanting across the left-hander, left alone.
stands tall and defends with soft hands to the off side.
beauty. This one nibbles away a wee bit to beat the outside edge as he felt for the delivery.
beaten as he plays inside the line of this full delivery.
skiddy length delivery on off stump, defended back.
tossed up outside off, driven gently into the covers, excellent stop
shortens his length, but he gets on top of the bounce and blocks.
steps out and whips this indrifter to deep square leg.
gets right to the pitch of the ball and smothers this full delivery.
width and he's slapped this into the gap, towards sweeper cover.
premeditated paddle, the slip fielder read it early and moved across to take this with a leap, but it just eluded him. Superb, full marks for the effort.
big appeal for lbw but the ball pitched miles outside leg. Ervine was beaten for pace and this hit him in line. No doubt where it was headed, but certainly there was an issue with where it pitched.
defends from the crease towards midwicket
whips this from length on middle towards deep midwicket
dabs this gently into the off side as they scamper a quick single.
veers in late, length much fuller as well. Raza defends with his bat close to the pad.
attacks the stumps with a length ball again, defended back with soft hands.
lunges forward and turns this gently into the leg side.
steps out and works this with the spin to long-on.
mistimes a cut to extra cover.
nice flight, he gets to the pitch of the ball and smothers this nicely.
lunges forward and smothers this away
drifts in and skids through, Raza right behind the line in defence.
stands tall and bunts this into the point region for a quick single.
punched into the deep cover region for an easy single.
dropped by Mushfiqur! Thick bottom edge as he feels for the ball away from the body, this kept going away, looked like the keeper was late to move and was on the move as he put this down.
deflects off the thigh pad into the leg side, looked to work this off his hip initially.
walks out of the crease and drives this to mid-off for a quick single
width outside off, slashed down to third man.
short of length and spinning away, Raza cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller around off stumps, turned away towards square leg
length ball, punched towards short midwicket
brings out the reverse sweep and beats the man at short third man for a much-needed boundary
fuller on stumps, driven towards long-on

bowls him with a beauty! Bring out the Nagin dance celebrations. It was a tad fuller, Raza played back but the ball turned sharply to beat the outside edge and hit the off stump. A dream delivery for any left-arm bowler
length ball, around middle and off, pushed towards mid-on
short of length, outside off, Ervine pushes at it but the extra bounce takes the ball over the slip fielder
length ball, around middle and off, defended
back of length around middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
length ball, just outside off, dabbed towards point for a single
length ball, just outside off, defended back towards the bowler
length ball around middle and leg, defended
length ball, pushed through with the arm, Williams punches it towards mid-on
length ball, on the pads, played gently towards short fine leg, a bit of hesitation but completed comfortably in the end
length again, tucked away towards square leg for another single
length outside off stump, punched off the back foot towards extra cover
beaten! Length ball, angled in with the arm but held its line after pitching to beat the bat
length ball, on the pads, defended
fuller on the pads, defended
length outside off, opens the face of the bat to collect a single to short third man
length ball, punched off the back foot towards the bowler
length again, just outside off, pushed towards extra cover
length ball, pitching just outside off and spinning sharply to beat the forward push
this one goes with arm, defended off the back foot
length ball, just outside off, pushed back towards the bowler
length again, pushed towards long-on for a single
short of length, goes back and pulls it towards long-on
fuller around off stump, driven towards long-off, 100 comes up for Zimbabwe with that single
bowled him! length ball, Ervine comes forward and pushes at it, the ball turns just a little bit but enough to beat the bat, the sound of timber. Zimbabwe five down for 100
length ball, comes forward and defends
length outside off, blocked off the front foot once more
a touch fuller and straighter this time, pushed towards short midwicket
fuller, just outside off, pushed back towards the bowler
fuller and worked past the non-striker, the ball dives across, collides with the non-striker, but fails to stop the ball. The bat drops from Williams' hand and he completes the single without the bat
length ball, around middle and leg, tucked away towards short midwicket
dropped short, Moor goes for the pull but ends up mistiming it to short midwicket once more
length ball, comes forward and pushes, gets beaten on the inside edge, Mushfiqur too fails to collect. Mushfiqur gathers the throw and flicks the ball through his leg but Moor was back home
fuller on pads, Moor sweeps it fine, past short fine leg for four
length ball, punched off the back foot but short midwicket slides across to make a stop to his left
pushed towards long-on for a walking single
fuller and driven towards deep extra cover, sweeper cover moves across to cut it off
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but mistimes it to extra cover
fuller, around off stump, pushed back towards the bowler
pitched up once more, comes forward and dead-bats
over-pitched again, driven back towards the bowler
length ball, punches of the back foot towards point, a fumble there but good recovery prevents the single
floated outside off, a big stride forward to push it towards extra cover
fired in with the arm, defended from the crease
fuller on stumps, driven back towards the bowler
brings out the reverse sweep but doesn't time it well, finds short third man
length ball, lunges forward to push it towards long-off
length ball, kept a bit low, Moor gets his bat down in time to keep it out
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards extra cover fence for four
short of length, kept a little low, pulled away towards backward square leg
length outside off, punched off the back foot towards long-off
fuller outside off, digs it out for a single to long-on
fuller on stumps, pushed back towards the bowler who jumps across to make a stop
length ball, punched off the back foot towards extra cover
fuller outside off, driven towards mid-off
length ball outside off, steered towards point but straight to the fielder
fuller around middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on, another dot
driven nicely! Full and straight and driven past the mid-on fielder, on his right, for four
and again, almost an action replay but didn't get the timing right, the mid-on cuts it off this time around
length outside off, left alone
full down the leg side and that will be a wide
and again, even wider this time
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller on the pads, goes for the sweep but doesn't get it right as the ball bounces towards short fine leg
fuller on pads, clipped away towards deep square leg
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it wide of long-off, sweeper cover moves across to make a diving stop
fuller on stumps, pushed back down the ground
fuller outside off, punched towards long-off
full and wide outside off, shouldered arms
length ball, just around off, defended
length ball, angling across, Moor was pushing at it but withdraws his bat at the last moment
jaffa! Pitches on a length around off stump and jumps at the batsman to beat the outside edge
length outside off, Moor looks to drive it on the up, gets beaten

slower one, on the pads, the batsman misses the flick, a big appeal for lbw but denied. Pitched outside leg, it seems. The batsmen collect a leg-bye in the meantime. Replays confirm it pitched well outside leg
tossed up outside off, Moor goes up and over and clears the long-off fence
length ball, just outside off, defended
a touch fuller on middle and leg, defended
length ball, pushed through, comes forward and defends
length ball, around middle, punched off the back foot towards long-on
length ball from around the wicket, Williams comes forward and blocks
length ball, outside off and going further away with the angle, Moor looks to drive it on the up, misses
back of length outside off, dabbed towards backward point
length ball, just around off, Moor was stuck in the crease, and gets beaten as he pushes at it
bouncer this time, but too wide outside off as Moor watches it go into the wicketkeeper's gloves
full and wide once again, left alone
fuller outside off from around the wicket, driven through covers for a couple
pitched up and driven past the mid-off fielder to end the over with a four
slides back in from round the stumps, punched to long-on.
gets outside the line of the stumps and smothers this.
sharp turn, bounce from the rough to hit him on the upper right thigh.
disastrous decision to sweep a full delivery. Plumb in front. This was full, fired dead straight and once he was hit on the pad, only one decision it was going to be.
edged past slip, third man runs around to cut that off.
hits this full toss straight back to the bowler.
slants a length ball back into the left-hander, tucked to fine leg. Mashrafe was running in very gently to deliver that
nips back in from length outside off, defended.

oh, dear. What on earth was Tiripano doing? Dabs it into the off side, and sets off for a run even though he saw his partner put his hand out to say no. Very good from Mahmud, who swooped in, picked up the ball and took a couple of steps towards the stumps before flicking an underarm throw to catch him short at the striker's end.
pulled away to deep midwicket
forces this length delivery into the off side, towards mid-off.
defends this incoming length delivery to mid-on.
plays all around a length ball on the stumps, but is hit high on the thigh pad. Height in question, so it can't be given. Even the bowler knew it
sweeps and misses, struck outside the line of the stumps.
nearly chipped this to the man coming in from short midwicket
eased with the spin to long-off
right behind the line as he defends
makes a bit of room and punches to extra cover.
off balance as he works this incoming length delivery off his hip to deep square.
width outside off, glides this down to deep point.
fetches this pull off a slower delivery from outside off, one hand came off the bat handle as he made contact.
wallops this pull to clear deep midwicket, the beauty of the stroke was that he hit it in front of square off the front foot. Made a sweet sound as he made contact
mistimes a pull towards the bowler.
pulls this all along the ground towards square leg.
he's picked the bones out of this reverse sweep, hit this all along the ground, so powerfully that short third man had no chance. Went past very quickly.
punched down towards the bowler who stops it on his followthrough
again the reverse, clears short third man, trickles into the boundary.
fired in on a length, defended back.
gets a long way forward and blocks.
sensational return catch diving to his left. This was struck so hard that you feared for Mehedy's fingers, but he instinctively dived, put both his hands out and plucked this out.
stands tall and punches to mid-off.
full delivery, late movement away, sliced on the bounce to point.
cuts away to beat the outside edge, lands short of the keeper and he lets this through, so they take a bye. Wasn't far from the off stump
length on middle and leg, whipped to deep square leg.
slower length ball angling into middle, defended with soft hands.
cutter that he lands short of length on off, punched to point.
squirts this to gully, there's a misfield but they don't take the run
slower and fuller on the stumps, defended from the crease to the bowler.
slapped wide of mid-off, flat-batted. Superb. Just backed away and belted this away
wild heave across the line, beaten.
stands tall and bunts this back towards the bowler.
angles in a length delivery on middle and off, turns this into the leg side.
punches this into the gap at extra cover.
reaches out to slap this over point, but misses.
ducks under this short ball outside off
works this from outside off towards square leg.
chipped wide of cover, down to wide long-off for a single
flat-bats this short delivery past mid-on. Ferocious hit. It was too short, deserved to be punished.
angling away, looks to slash but misses. Umpire deems this to be too far wide outside off.
shows the full face of the bat and defends.
slower and fuller on the stumps, pushed to cover.
slower and angling across on a length outside off, punched to deep cover.
full on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
wild swing and a miss to a length ball angling away
full and angling into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
has he feathered this? Not quite. Banged in short, looked to fetch the pull from outside off, beaten.
right behind the line as he punches back.
sees this in his half and belts this down the ground to bisect long-off and long-on.
gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg, looked to hoick across the line
forced off the backfoot to sweeper cover.
back of length on middle, punched to long-on
excellent reverse sweep, takes this on the full and picks the gap at third man.
swept from outside off towards deep backward square leg, even though one hand came off the grip, he still ensured this was timed beautifully
fired full, deflects off the pad into the leg side as he misses the flick
tossed up on middle and leg, eased to long-on
muscled and this has sailed over the ropes at deep midwicket. Saw it in his half, got underneath the flight and swung this away.
banged in short, he makes room and pulls to deep square. The bowler followed him as he made room
backs away to flat-bat this cover but is deceived by the slower delivery, through with the shot early and this just whizzes past the off stump
oversteps, so it's a no-ball and that means a free-hit. For the record, this one's been bunted to mid-off for a single
works this off a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket
off the thigh pad as they scamper a run to short fine leg. Looked to whip this square.
makes room and lofts this down to long-on, not much timing.
plays outside the line, nearly chopped on. Off a thick inside edge to short fine.
backs away and mistimes an attempted slog back to the bowler
beaten as he backs away to carve this over point.
late reverse back in from outside off, squeezed to square leg
toe-ends a slog to midwicket
superb shot! Makes room, gets underneath the length of this slower delivery and belts this back past the bowler. Long-on had no chance despite a full-length dive
toe-ends a lofted hit to long-off.
mistimes this reverse sweep to point.
swung away to clear long-on. Not a bad delivery, just made easier because the batsman had nothing to lose and just swung this away with all his might
make that six more, backs away, the length is shorter and so he stays his ground and wallops this cross-batted hit over wide long-on again
swings and misses. He bowled it from even behind the umpire. Oh, wait. No, there was a thin edge as confirmed by snicko. Thinnest of nicks, which means Jarvis has to walk back.
fired full, he gets outside the line and blocks.
wallops this full toss from outside off towards deep square leg.
dabs this into the leg side as they jog the single
heaved across the line, off a thick inside edge towards deep square
whips this full delivery into the leg side
off a thick inside edge to fine leg, once again swung blindly.
slower bouncer, flat-batted to long-on. Game, set, match Bangladesh.
